Detailed Description

This class manages the current working set of ChunkFlora objects, and provides world coordinate access to them.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ChunkFloraManager::~ChunkFloraManager (  ) 

Destructor.

By this time, all ChunkFlora items should have been removed from the manager, and this means all our internal data structures will have been freed too.

Member Function Documentation

void ChunkFloraManager::add ( ChunkFlora *  pChunkFlora  ) 

This method adds a Chunk Flora object to the manager.

From here on in it can provide custom flora information to the Flora system.

Parameters:
pChunkFlora pointer to the ChunkFlora object.

void ChunkFloraManager::del ( ChunkFlora *  pChunkFlora  ) 

This method removes a Chunk Flora object from the manager.

The manager cleans up its own allocated structures in this method when it can. This means that if you remove all ChunkFlora objects that were added, the ChunkFloraManager will have cleaned up all memory - thus nothing needs to be done in the destructor.

Parameters:
pChunkFlora pointer to the ChunkFlora object.

Ecotype::ID ChunkFloraManager::ecotypeAt ( const Vector2 &  worldPos  ) 

This method returns the ecotype ID at the given position.

If there is custom IDs at the position, it looks it up and uses that information. Otherwise, it returns ECOTYPE_ID_AUTO meaning, make up your own ecotype ID.

static ChunkFloraManager& ChunkFloraManager::instance ( void   )  [inline, static]
